summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2002 CHINOOK DESTINY 2400 RV BUILT ON A 2002 CHEVROLET EXPRESS CHASSIS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE RV WAS STORED AWAY FOR APPROXIMATELY 6 MONTHS. AFTER STARTING THE VEHICLE, THE ODOR OF FUEL WAS PRESENT. UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT FUEL WAS POURING OUT FROM UNDERNEATH THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE LOCAL DEALER BRADLEY CHEVROLET LOCATED AT 711 N LAKE HAVASU AVE, LAKE HAVASU CITY, AZ 86403, WHO DIAGNOSED THAT A PLASTIC FITTING IN THE FUEL LINE WAS DEFECTIVE AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE FITTING WAS REPLACED WITH A BRASS FITTING AND THE FAILURE WAS REMEDIED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 90,600. *BF*JB
